DOC.brief_summary: To determine biophysical impact biophysical Impact Transcutaneous Spinal Cord Stimulation ( TSCS ) within single session . We hypothesize subject demonstrate increase volitional muscle strength TSCS . This assessed isokinetic strength test post-injury dominant-side knee extension . Subjects test Transcutaneous Spinal Cord Stimulation sham condition .
DOC.brief_title: The Biophysical Impact Transcutaneous Spinal Cord Stimulation Within Single Session
DOC.detailed_description: The investigator conduct isokinetic strength testing ( via Biodex ) post-injury , dominant-side knee extension , , TSCS sham condition . Transcutaneous Spinal Cord Stimulation apply ( via Vectra Neo ) use 5cm x10cm oval electrode place midline skin spinous process T11 -T12 cathode two 7.5cm x 13cm rectangular electrode place symmetrically skin low abdomen anode . A symmetrical biphasic rectangular waveform , 50Hz 1millisecond , use provide 30 continuous minute stimulation . As sham procedure intervention establish , investigator follow sham procedure well document Transcranial DC Stimulation ( tDCS ) . Electrodes place Transcutaneous Spinal Cord Stimulation condition . Stimulation apply subject 's maximum intensity 30 second discontinue . Subjects participate two test session , approximately one hour length , separate least 24 hour . Subject 's start condition randomize . Subjects inform two stimulation condition test , tell experimental condition .
DOC.criteria: > 1 year post spinal cord injury Nonprogressive spinal cord injury Neurological level T10 Tolerates upright position > 30 minute Medically stable ( hospitalization last 3 month ) Unilateral knee extension strength > /= 1/5 MMT Able comply procedure follow Are legally able make health care decision Progressive SCI/D ( MS , ALS , ADEM , etc . ) Opens wounds stimulation site Pregnant woman ROM limit > 10 degree knee flexion extension Cardiac pacemaker/defibrillator Active cancer diagnosis Currently receive TSCS Evidence uncontrolled autonomic dysreflexia Non English speaking
